study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of folic acid supplementation, alone or combined with vitamins B6 and B12, in preventing stroke through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Folic acid supplementation showed a mild, non-significant trend in reducing stroke risk (RR=0.93). Greater benefits were observed in non-secondary prevention trials (RR=0.89) and when combined with B vitamins (RR=0.83), particularly in male-dominated trials (RR=0.84).
population_specificity: 39,005 participants across 13 trials, with noted benefits in male-dominated cohorts (men:women >2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the potential therapeutic and diagnostic benefits of backward walking in elderly individuals and those with specific neurological and metabolic conditions.
results_summary: The study found that backward walking can help restore stable body position and gait in individuals with hemiplegia post-stroke, Parkinson's disease, and diabetic foot syndrome. It also noted its diagnostic utility in assessing coordination impairments and fall risk in the elderly.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals, persons with hemiplegia after stroke, Parkinson's disease patients, and those with diabetic foot syndrome.

study_goal: To investigate the effectiveness of backward walking in treating gait impairments related to neurological and musculoskeletal disorders.
results_summary: Backward walking combined with conventional physiotherapy significantly reduced pain and functional disability and improved quadriceps strength in knee osteoarthritis patients. It also improved balance and stability in juvenile rheumatoid arthritis and gait parameters and muscle strength in anterior cruciate ligament injury, but no significant benefits were found for other conditions.
population_specificity: People with gait impairments related to neurological and musculoskeletal disorders (e.g., knee osteoarthritis, juvenile rheumatoid arthritis, anterior cruciate ligament injury).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility of backward walking observational training on gait ability in chronic stroke patients.
results_summary: Both groups showed significant improvements in gait ability, but the experimental group (backward walking observation) demonstrated more significant improvements in dynamic gait index, 10-m walking test, and timed up and go test time compared to the control group. The findings suggest that backward walking observational training combined with conventional therapy enhances gait ability in chronic stroke patients.
population_specificity: Chronic stroke patients (n=14).
effective_dosage: Observational training 3 days/week + conventional therapy 5 days/week.

study_goal: To compare the effects of backward walking training versus forward walking training on spatiotemporal gait parameters and gross motor function in children with cerebral palsy.
results_summary: Backward walking training significantly improved step length, walking velocity, cadence, stance phase, swing phase percentage, and gross motor function measures compared to forward walking training, with improvements maintained at 1-month follow-up.
population_specificity: 30 children (10-14 years old) with hemiparetic cerebral palsy (GMFCS levels I or II).
effective_dosage: 25 minutes per session, three sessions per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of backward and lateral walking training on improving walking function in poststroke patients and determine which method was more effective.
results_summary: The study found that lateral walking training significantly improved gait velocity, stride length, and gait asymmetry compared to backward walking training and the control group. Backward walking training did not show superior benefits over lateral walking training in improving gait parameters.
population_specificity: 51 subjects with hemiplegic stroke.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of progressive body weight supported treadmill forward and backward walking training (PBWSTFBWT) versus forward-only (PBWSTFWT) or backward-only (PBWSTBWT) training on stroke patients' lower extremity walking ability.
results_summary: All three training groups showed significant improvements in walking ability metrics (step length, stance phase, swing phase, single support, step time). The PBWSTFBWT group demonstrated more significant improvements across all assessed items compared to the other two groups.
population_specificity: 36 chronic stroke patients, divided into three groups of 12.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes per session, six times per week.
study_duration: 3 weeks of intervention, followed by general physical therapy until follow-up tests.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of folate and other B-vitamins in reducing homocysteine levels in epileptic patients with hyperhomocysteinemia and discuss the most appropriate supplementation scheme.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid alone or combined with other B-vitamins reduces homocysteine levels in epileptic patients on chronic antiepileptic treatment, but the optimal supplementation regimen remains unclear.
population_specificity: Patients with epilepsy, particularly those with elevated plasma homocysteine levels due to MTHFR gene polymorphisms or chronic antiepileptic drug use.
interactions: Older antiepileptic drugs were noted to elevate homocysteine levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether backward treadmill walking is superior to forward treadmill walking in improving walking capacity, parameters, quality, and balance in people with stroke.
results_summary: The study hypothesized that backward treadmill walking would outperform forward walking in improving walking capacity and related metrics, but results were not yet reported as the abstract describes a planned trial.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling people after stroke (n=88).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether additional backward walking training improves postural control in children with hemiparetic cerebral palsy compared to traditional physical therapy alone.
results_summary: The study found that backward walking training significantly improved overall, anteroposterior, and mediolateral stability indices at both stable and moderately unstable levels compared to the control group. Both groups showed improvements, but the experimental group demonstrated greater gains.
population_specificity: Thirty children (10-14 years, 14 girls and 16 boys) with spastic hemiparetic cerebral palsy.

study_goal: To investigate the effect of backward walking training combined with alpha-lipoic acid (ALA) on plantar pressure distribution in patients with diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN).
results_summary: The combination therapy of backward walking and ALA significantly reduced peak plantar pressure in the forefoot and improved pressure distribution compared to ALA alone. Backward walking also enhanced balance ability and muscle strength in DPN patients.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetic peripheral neuropathy (N=60).
effective_dosage: Backward walking exercise for 12 weeks (frequency not specified); ALA for 2 weeks (dosage not specified).
study_duration: 12 weeks for backward walking; 2 weeks for ALA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of backward walking (BW) and forward walking (FW) using body weight supported treadmill training (BWSTT) in an individual with quadriparesis due to spinal cord injury (SCI).
results_summary: Both BW and FW training led to similar improvements in gait parameters, timed 4-meter walk, 6-minute walk test, tandem balance, and aerobic endurance. BW training showed greater improvement in the 5-repetition sit-to-stand test (STST) compared to FW.
population_specificity: A 57-year-old male with incomplete C3-C6 spinal cord injury.
study_duration: 18 weeks total (ABABAB design, 3 weeks per phase).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if an 8-week backward walking (BW) treadmill training could improve gross motor function, weight-bearing symmetry, and gait parameters in individuals with spastic cerebral palsy.
results_summary: Participants showed statistically significant improvements in gross motor function, weight-bearing symmetry, forward walking velocity, and step/stride length after BW training. The study suggests BW therapy may enhance walking abilities and gross motor skills in this population.
population_specificity: Children aged 5-15 years with spastic cerebral palsy (n=12).
effective_dosage: Up to 20 minutes per session, three sessions per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility of administering Backward Walking Training (BWT) during inpatient rehabilitation and compare its effectiveness to Standing Balance Training (SBT) on walking speed, balance, and balance-related efficacy in acute stroke patients.
results_summary: BWT resulted in significantly greater improvements in both forward and backward walking speed compared to SBT at 1-month postintervention, with large effect sizes for balance confidence and moderate effects for balance and mobility. The study concluded that BWT is a feasible and beneficial addition to acute stroke rehabilitation.
population_specificity: Eighteen individuals 1-week poststroke.
effective_dosage: Eight, 30-minute sessions of BWT or SBT in addition to scheduled therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether backward walking (BW) training improves balance in school-aged boys compared to forward walking (FW).
results_summary: The study found that BW training significantly improved balance in the experimental group after 8 weeks, with effects persisting at 12 weeks. Kinematic analysis showed differences between BW and FW (e.g., longer stance phase in BW) but no differences between groups in gait kinematics post-training.
population_specificity: Sixteen healthy boys aged 7.19 ± 0.40 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of Mof expression and H4K16 acetylation in Purkinje cell survival and function, and how their absence leads to motor coordination deficits, including a backward-walking phenotype.
results_summary: Mice with PC-specific Mof deficiency exhibited impaired motor coordination, ataxia, and a backward-walking phenotype, indicating cerebellar dysfunction. Treatment with histone deacetylase inhibitors modestly prolonged Purkinje cell survival but did not fully reverse the deficits.
population_specificity: Atm-deficient mice with Purkinje cell-specific Mof gene deletion.

study_goal: To examine the effectiveness of additional backward walking training on gait outcomes in post-stroke patients.
results_summary: The experimental group showed significant improvements in walking speed, stride length, and symmetry index compared to the control group after three weeks of additional backward walking training.
population_specificity: Post-stroke patients with lower extremity Brunnstrom motor recovery stage 3 or 4, able to walk 11 meters with or without aids.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes of backward walking training, three times per week.

study_goal: To examine the effectiveness of backward walking treadmill training for restoring motor function, balance, and walking speed in stroke patients.
results_summary: The experimental group showed significant improvements in motor function (FMA-L score), balance (BBS score), and walking speed (10 m MWS) compared to the control group after three weeks of training.
population_specificity: 26 stroke patients (17 males, 9 females) aged 36-64 with lower extremity Brunnstrom motor recovery stage 3 or 4, able to walk 10 m unaided.
effective_dosage: 30-minute backward walking training five times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between heart rate, oxygen consumption, and backward walking speeds to enable precise prescription of backward walking for women.
results_summary: The study found curvilinear relationships between oxygen consumption and backward walking speed, as well as between heart rate and speed, allowing clinicians to prescribe specific speeds to elicit desired cardiopulmonary responses.
population_specificity: Twenty-five healthy, adult female volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the roles of catecholamine and 5-HT release in mediating backward walking and circling behaviors in rats.
results_summary: The study found that backward walking and circling were induced by simultaneous dopamine and 5-HT release, with (+)-amphetamine, p-chloroamphetamine, or fenfluramine administration. Dopamine-dependent behaviors were reduced by 5-HT-releasing drugs, while 5-HT-dependent behaviors were unaffected by (+)-amphetamine.
population_specificity: Rats
effective_dosage: (+)-amphetamine (5-15 mg/kg), p-chloroamphetamine (2-5 mg/kg), fenfluramine (5 mg/kg), levallorphan (50 mg/kg)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining choline with Bacopa Monnieri (BM) and Withania somnifera (WS) extracts could enhance cholinergic activity and mitigate memory deficits induced by chronic stress.
results_summary: The combination of choline and adaptogens (CBW) counteracted oxidative stress in microglial cells, reduced neurotoxicity, and improved recognition memory in mice.
population_specificity: BV2 microglial cells and SH-SY5Y cell lines (in vitro), and mice (in vivo).
study_duration: 24 hours (in vitro), duration in mice not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa monnieri's phyto-compounds for their potential as acetylcholinesterase inhibitors and neuroprotective agents in neurodegenerative disorders.
results_summary: The study identified four compounds (quercetin, apigenin, wogonin, and bacopaside X) with strong acetylcholinesterase inhibitory activity, with IC50 values ranging from 12.73 μM to 15.48 μM, though less potent than donepezil (IC50: 0.0204 μM). In silico and in vitro analyses suggest these compounds may modulate molecular targets linked to neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in silico study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the synergistic effects of Bacopa monnieri phytocompounds (quercetin and bacopaside X) on neurodegeneration, antioxidant activity, and cognition in a scopolamine-induced Alzheimer's disease mice model.
results_summary: The study found that quercetin and bacopaside X improved cognitive performance, reduced oxidative stress markers, and modulated gene expression related to neuroprotection in the AD mice model. The combination showed synergistic benefits in neuroprotection and antioxidant activity.
population_specificity: Scopolamine-induced Alzheimer's disease mice model.
effective_dosage: Quercetin (25 mg/kg), bacopaside X (20 mg/kg), and their combination (25 mg/kg + 20 mg/kg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Bacopa monnieri in reducing acetic-acid-induced ulcerative colitis in mice.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri extract and its saponin-rich fraction significantly reduced colonic inflammation, MPO levels, and disease activity scores in a dose-dependent manner compared to the control group. The saponin-rich fraction appeared particularly effective.
population_specificity: Mice with acetic-acid-induced ulcerative colitis.
effective_dosage: 20 mg/kg and 40 mg/kg (extract); 5 mg/kg and 10 mg/kg (saponin-rich fraction), administered orally.
study_duration: 7 days (2 days pre-treatment and 5 days post-induction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the molecular mechanisms and therapeutic potential of Bacopa monnieri against liver cancer using data mining, network pharmacology, and molecular docking analysis.
results_summary: The study identified key phytochemicals in Bacopa monnieri (e.g., quercetin, luteolin) that may inhibit liver cancer growth by targeting genes like TP53, IL6, and JUN. Microarray and survival analyses suggested HSP90AA1 and JUN as potential diagnostic biomarkers, while molecular docking confirmed strong binding affinity of these compounds.
population_specificity: Liver cancer (in silico and microarray data analysis; no human or animal subjects explicitly mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Bacopa Monnieri extract on emotional function, motor activity, and quality of life in Parkinson's disease patients.
results_summary: The study found time-dependent improvements in emotional function with Bacopa Monnieri at 450 mg/day but no significant differences in other symptoms. A strong correlation was observed between quality of life and motor outcomes at baseline and 30 days, with moderate correlations at 60 and 90 days.
population_specificity: Twenty volunteers with Parkinson's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of metal-tolerant rhizospheric bacteria on Bacopa monnieri's growth, physiology, and biochemical responses under copper and iron stress conditions.
results_summary: The study found that certain rhizospheric bacteria (N. humi, A. aquaticus, and R. syzygii) significantly improved Bacopa monnieri's height, biomass, and Bacoside A content under normal and metal stress conditions, while high concentrations of copper and iron negatively impacted growth and photosynthetic pigments.
population_specificity: Bacopa monnieri plants exposed to copper and iron stress in pot conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri could inhibit Tau aggregation, reduce oxidative stress, and restore nuclear transport in Tau-stressed Neuro2a cells as a potential treatment for Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri inhibited Tau aggregation, reduced ROS and caspase-3 activity, restored Nrf2 levels, decreased phospho-Tau load, and corrected NUP358 misarrangement in formaldehyde-stressed Neuro2a cells.
population_specificity: Neuro2a cells (a mouse neuroblastoma cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify natural compounds in Bacopa monnieri that could interact with STXBP1 to potentially treat schizophrenia and related neuronal disorders.
results_summary: The study identified CID:5319292 as the best compound based on binding energy (-10.3 kcal/mol) and found that the STXBP1-CID:5281800 complex showed stable dynamics with low RMSD values (0.3-0.4 nm), suggesting potential therapeutic utility.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the phytochemistry, pharmacological features, and molecular mechanisms of Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) in relation to neurological disorders and cognitive enhancement.
results_summary: The study found that BME exhibits neuroprotective effects, potentially mitigating neuroinflammation, neurotoxicity, and Tau and amyloid-beta aggregation, which are linked to neurological disorders. It also highlighted BME's cognitive-enhancing properties and synergistic potential in therapeutic interventions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurological disorder context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular interactions of Bacopa monnieri phytochemicals with neurotrophins to assess their potential as anti-neurodegenerative drugs.
results_summary: The study found that several phytochemicals in Bacopa monnieri (Vitamin E, BPA, Stigmasterol, and Nonacosane) exhibited strong binding affinity with neurotrophins, stable molecular interactions, and favorable ADME-Tox properties, suggesting their potential as effective anti-neurodegenerative agents.
population_specificity: In-silico study (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective activity of Bacopa monnieri-loaded solid lipid nanoparticles delivered via dissolvable microneedle arrays for Parkinson's disease treatment.
results_summary: The microneedle patches demonstrated mechanical robustness, non-irritancy, and improved motor coordination, balance, and reduced bradykinesia compared to systemic delivery methods. The transdermal delivery achieved lower effective doses and potential for long-term home-based treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical or animal model based on methods described).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inoculation with specific endophytes (Bacillus subtilis and Klebsiella aerogenes) could enhance Bacoside A accumulation and plant biomass in Bacopa monnieri.
results_summary: The study found that co-cultivation with a consortium of endophytes significantly increased Bacoside A content and plant biomass compared to single inoculation, with upregulated expression of key biosynthetic pathway genes and transcription factors.
population_specificity: Bacopa monnieri plants (in vitro and in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review biotechnological approaches for the propagation and production of bacoside A in Bacopa monnieri, as well as its biosynthesis and potential for sustainable bioactive molecule production.
results_summary: The study highlights Bacopa monnieri's neuro-tonic properties, antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities, and the use of tissue culture techniques to enhance bacoside A production. It identifies bioreactor-based technology as a promising method for commercial-scale propagation.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antibacterial potential of Bacopa monnieri leaf extracts and its bioactive molecules against urinary tract infections caused by Klebsiella pneumoniae and Proteus mirabilis.
results_summary: Methanolic and ethanolic extracts of Bacopa monnieri showed significant inhibition zones against K. pneumoniae and P. mirabilis, with Oroxindin identified as a potent bioactive molecule exhibiting strong binding interactions and stability in molecular dynamics simulations. The study suggests Oroxindin's potential as a future drug candidate for UTIs.
population_specificity: In vitro study targeting uropathogens (Klebsiella pneumoniae and Proteus mirabilis).
effective_dosage: Not specified (tested increasing concentrations of extracts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate a potential drug-herb interaction between Bacopa Monnieri and cevimeline in a patient with Sjögren's syndrome.
results_summary: The study reported adverse effects (hyperhidrosis, malaise, nausea, tachycardia) in a patient taking Bacopa Monnieri alongside cevimeline, suggesting a possible interaction affecting drug metabolism. Symptoms resolved after discontinuing the supplement.
population_specificity: A 58-year-old Caucasian female with Sjögren's syndrome.
interactions: Possible interaction with cevimeline due to Bacopa Monnieri's effect on cytochrome P450 enzymes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the interaction of Bacopa Monnieri-derived compounds with the Tau protein involved in Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that compounds like bacopaside II and bacopaside XII showed optimal binding features with the R2 repeat domain of hyperphosphorylated tau protein, suggesting potential relevance for Alzheimer's disease treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or computational study implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical efficacy and safety of Bacopa monnieri in individuals with mild, moderate, or severe dementia, or mild cognitive impairment due to Alzheimer disease.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference between Bacopa monnieri and placebo or donepezil in treating Alzheimer disease, based on very low certainty evidence. No major safety issues were reported, but the overall quality of evidence was deemed very low due to high risk of bias and imprecision.
population_specificity: Adults with dementia or mild cognitive impairment due to Alzheimer disease.
study_duration: Varied across studies (not specified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri could improve depression-like symptoms in reserpine-induced depression and compare its efficacy to citalopram.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri reduced immobility time in the forced swimming test, restored neurotransmitter levels (serotonin, dopamine, norepinephrine), and improved neuroprotective markers (BDNF, Bcl-2) while reducing inflammatory markers (MCP-1, FAS), with effects comparable to citalopram.
population_specificity: Adult male albino rats with reserpine-induced depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biotechnological approaches for producing bacosides from Bacopa monnieri and highlight its pharmacological benefits and future potential.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri has demonstrated efficacy in treating neurological disorders like Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, and epilepsy, with bacosides showing anti-ageing, anticancer, and anti-inflammatory properties. The study also discusses the variability in bacoside concentration and explores in vitro production methods.
population_specificity: Not specified (general pharmacological and biotechnological review).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory and regenerative properties of Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) in an in vitro model of neuroinflammation.
results_summary: BME protected against cytotoxicity in SH-SY5Y cells, reduced pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-1β, IL-6, COX-2, iNOS), mitigated trauma-induced damage, and accelerated wound healing in TNFα and IFNγ-primed cells.
population_specificity: Neuronal SH-SY5Y cells (in vitro model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri (CDRI 08®) could reduce inattention and hyperactivity and improve cognitive, mood, and sleep outcomes in young children.
results_summary: The study found no significant behavioral improvements but noted cognitive benefits (reduced errors, improved flexibility, executive functioning) and mood/sleep enhancements in children taking Bacopa monnieri compared to placebo. Reaction time improved more in the placebo group.
population_specificity: Male children aged 6 to 14 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of Bacopa monnieri and its active compounds (bacosides) in managing neurological disorders, focusing on its mechanisms and signaling pathways.
results_summary: The study highlights Bacopa monnieri's potential as a memory enhancer and its bioactive compounds' synergistic effects in neurological disorders. It also discusses the signaling pathways modulated by bacosides.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurological disorder context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the MeJA and wound-responsive BmG10H-1 transcript in Bacopa monnieri and investigate its transcriptional regulation by the MYB transcription factor.
results_summary: The study identified and characterized the BmG10H-1 transcript, demonstrating its enzymatic activity in converting geraniol to 10-hydroxy geraniol. The BmG10H-1 promoter was found to drive GUS expression in response to MeJA and wounding, with BmMYB35 regulating its transcription by binding to the promoter.
population_specificity: In vitro and transgenic Arabidopsis thaliana models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective and neurorescue effects of Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) in a mouse model of MPTP-induced Parkinson's disease.
results_summary: BME treatment significantly improved behavioral parameters, dopamine levels, and antioxidant markers in mice, with greater effects observed when administered before MPTP exposure. In silico analysis suggested BME constituents may inhibit monoamine oxidase B, preventing MPTP conversion to its toxic metabolite.
population_specificity: MPTP-induced Parkinson's disease mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-convulsant effects of Bacopa monnieri extracts in PTZ-induced epileptic rats, focusing on cholinergic system modulation and ATPase activity.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri extracts reversed PTZ-induced decreases in AChE and ATPase activity and normalized acetylcholine levels, suggesting neuroprotective effects against epileptogenesis, except for EAE and AE extracts.
population_specificity: PTZ-induced epileptic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri, combined with cognitive training, enhances long-term potentiation and cognitive health in older adults.
results_summary: The study found mixed results, with Bacopa Monnieri improving accuracy but slowing reaction time in some tasks, while neuroimaging suggested increased network complexity but decreased neurite density. No other outcomes reached statistical significance.
population_specificity: 28 healthy adults aged over 55 years

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of Bacopa monnieri (brahmi) 300 mg once daily versus donepezil 10 mg once daily in patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and mild cognitive impairment (MCI-AD) over 12 months.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in cognitive outcomes (ADAS-Cog) between brahmi and donepezil at any time point. However, there was a significant difference in the total PGI Memory Scale score at the last follow-up, though no difference in individual memory scale scores.
population_specificity: 34 patients with AD and MCI-AD

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanisms by which Bacopa monnieri extracts limit proliferation and induce apoptosis-like events in RAD1-deleted yeast, a model for colorectal cancer.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri extracts promoted mutations in rad1∆ yeast and disrupted the vacuole, leading to protease release and an apoptosis-like event dependent on Yca1p. The toxicity was linked to sterol content, with bacopasaponin C identified as a potential drug candidate for colorectal cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Saccharomyces cerevisiae (yeast) model of colorectal cancer (RAD1-deleted).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the memory-enhancing effects of Bacopa monnieri, Ginkgo biloba, and Lavandula angustifolia, individually and in combination, in scopolamine-induced amnesia in mice.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri significantly reduced escape latency and path length in memory tests and increased time spent in the platform quadrant, demonstrating memory enhancement. The mixture of extracts showed synergistic effects compared to individual treatments.
population_specificity: Mice with scopolamine-induced amnesia
study_duration: Acute trials (up to day 6), chronic trials (days 8-14)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri extract (CDRI-08/BME) could mitigate prenatal stress-induced neurodevelopmental and behavioral impairments in rat offspring.
results_summary: BME treatment reduced anxiety-like behavior and memory deficits in offspring, counteracting stress-induced changes in molecular markers related to stress response, synaptic function, and apoptosis. The antioxidant properties of BME were suggested as a potential mechanism for these protective effects.
population_specificity: Pregnant Wistar rats and their offspring.
study_duration: Administered to dams from gestational day 10 to postnatal day 23, and to offspring from postnatal day 15 to 30.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the chemical composition of Bacopa monnieri extracts (BcH, BcS) and their combined anti-proliferative potential with propolis in glioblastoma cell lines.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa monnieri extracts contained saponins like bacoside A3 and bacopaside II, and their combination with propolis significantly inhibited viability and proliferation in glioblastoma cells compared to individual extracts.
population_specificity: Glioblastoma cell lines (T98G, LN-18, U87MG)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective potential of Bacopa monnieri extracts against neuroinflammation and neurodegeneration.
results_summary: The study suggests Bacopa monnieri has notable neuroprotective effects, potentially useful for treating neurodegenerative disorders, though specific outcomes are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on neurodegenerative disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa monnieri's ability to prevent glutamate toxicity, reduce mitochondrial and ER stress, and assess its effects on lifespan and aging in Caenorhabditis elegans.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri hexane extract prevented glutamate toxicity in HT-22 cells by reducing ROS production and preventing mitochondrial/ER stress. It also increased median and maximal lifespan in C. elegans while maintaining a younger phenotype.
population_specificity: HT-22 cells and wild-type Caenorhabditis elegans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri extract (BME) improves spatial working memory and promotes hippocampal neurogenesis in healthy adolescent and adult mice.
results_summary: BME improved spatial working memory in adolescent mice but not adults, with effects lasting 4 weeks post-treatment. BME enhanced hippocampal neurogenesis, likely due to bacopaside I, which promoted neural progenitor cell proliferation via Akt and ERK1/2 signaling.
population_specificity: Adolescent (5-week-old) and adult (8-week-old) healthy mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to uncover the molecular mechanisms of Bacopa Monnieri-derived compounds in treating neurological diseases like Alzheimer's and Spinocerebellar ataxia using cheminformatics and system pharmacological approaches.
results_summary: The study identified 52 active compounds and 780 direct receptors, with asiatic acid (ASTA) and loliolide (LLD) highlighted as novel compounds for treating Alzheimer's and SCA. Bacopa compounds showed potential in regulating biological processes related to neurological diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (computational study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the efficacy of a standardized Bacopa Monnieri extract (20% bacosides) in counteracting anhedonia in both preclinical (mouse) and clinical (human) settings.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri extract dose-dependently reduced depressive-like behaviors in mice and improved sucrose preference, while also modulating biomarkers like cytokines and brain-derived neurotrophic factor. In humans, combining Bacopa Monnieri with citalopram significantly improved anhedonia and depression scores compared to citalopram alone.
population_specificity: Mice with LPS-induced depressive-like syndrome and 42 human patients with significant anhedonia (SHAPS score ≥ 3).
effective_dosage: Mice: 50-200 mg/kg daily; Humans: 300 mg twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Bacopa Monnieri's bioactive constituents, pharmacological activities, and micropropagation techniques for commercial production.
results_summary: The study found Bacopa Monnieri has multiple pharmacological benefits, including memory enhancement, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory effects, and demonstrated successful micropropagation methods for high-yield plant production.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of plant properties and propagation techniques).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the binding interactions between Bacopa monnieri compounds and human cholinesterase enzymes (AChE and BuChE) to assess their potential as inhibitors for Alzheimer's disease treatment.
results_summary: The study found that bacoside X, bacoside A, 3-beta-D-glucosylstigmasterol, and daucosterol exhibited strong binding interactions with AChE and BuChE, suggesting they could be effective inhibitors of these enzymes. The analysis highlighted hydrophobic interactions, hydrogen bonds, and binding energy as key factors in their inhibitory potential.
population_specificity: In silico (computational) study (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Bacopa monnieri in phytoremediating sewage (greywater) using SHEFROL® bioreactors.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri significantly reduced levels of suspended solids, chemical oxygen demand, biological oxygen demand, nitrogen, phosphorus, zinc, copper, nickel, and manganese by 41-90% within a hydraulic retention time of 6 hours. The system demonstrated simultaneous primary, secondary, and tertiary treatment capabilities, suggesting it is simple, rapid, and economical.
population_specificity: Greywater (sewage) in SHEFROL® bioreactors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) could modulate transthyretin (TTR) amyloidogenesis and disrupt preformed fibrils.
results_summary: BME prevented the formation of human TTR aggregates and mature fibrils but did not dis-aggregate pre-formed fibrils. It also enhanced the structural stability of native TTR by binding at the thyroxine-binding site and mitigating tetramer dissociation.
population_specificity: In vitro study (human TTR and L55P TTR proteins)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the neuroprotective effects of Bacopa monnieri (BM) in regulating neuroinflammation and reducing α-synuclein levels in a Parkinson's disease (PD) animal model.
results_summary: BM administration suppressed pro-inflammatory cytokines, decreased α-synuclein levels, and reduced reactive oxygen species (ROS) generation in the PD model. Pre-treatment with BM showed more prominent effects compared to co- and post-treatment.
population_specificity: PD animal model (specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective properties of Bacopa Monnieri (Brahmi) and its bioactive components in inhibiting Tau-mediated toxicity and improving cognitive function in Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa Monnieri and its bioactive components reduce ROS, neuroinflammation, inhibit Amyloid-β aggregation, and improve cognitive and learning behavior, suggesting potential as a treatment for Alzheimer's disease and other neurological disorders.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurological disorders, particularly Alzheimer's disease)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective properties of Bacopa monnieri and its bacosides, focusing on their potential impact on Alzheimer disease pathology.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa monnieri and its bacosides exhibit neuroprotective properties, with potential applications in slowing Alzheimer disease progression. The review highlighted clinical, cellular, and phytochemical data supporting its therapeutic use.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Bacopa monnieri extracts on neuronal stem cells (NSC) to determine its potential for nervous tissue injury repair.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri extracts promoted dendritic formation in NSC at concentrations of 5 and 10 µg/mL, with reduced effects at 20 µg/mL. The study suggests BM may aid nervous tissue regeneration, though further validation is needed.
population_specificity: Newborn albino rats (Rattus norvegicus).
effective_dosage: 2 μL suspensions containing 5, 10, and 20 µg/mL of BM extract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri extract (BME) could protect against cognitive dysfunction and promote neuronal repair in a mouse model of trimethyltin-induced hippocampal damage.
results_summary: BME significantly prevented cognitive deficits induced by TMT, protected hippocampal neurons, and promoted neuroregeneration in the dentate gyrus after 30 days of treatment.
population_specificity: Mice with TMT-induced hippocampal neuronal loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the cognitive-enhancement and neuroprotective effects of Bacopa Monnieri (Brahmi) on GABAergic neuronal density and novel object recognition memory in a PCP-induced schizophrenic-like rat model.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri partially restored cognitive deficits and increased GABAergic neuronal density (CB, PV, CR) in various brain regions, showing both cognitive-enhancement and neuroprotective effects in the PCP rat model.
population_specificity: Sub-chronic PCP-induced schizophrenic-like rat model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of Bacopa monnieri (BME) on alcohol abstinence-induced anxiety-like behavior and its underlying mechanisms in rats.
results_summary: BME at doses of 200 mg/kg and 500 mg/kg alleviated anxiety-like behavior and reversed elevated alcohol biomarkers and downregulated Gabra1, Gabra4, and Gabra5 gene expression in rats during alcohol abstinence, while 100 mg/kg showed insignificant effects.
population_specificity: Wistar rats exposed to voluntary alcohol ingestion.
effective_dosage: 100, 200, and 500 mg/kg administered via gavage for three consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri (brahmi) could inhibit protein misfolding and aggregation, specifically of hen egg white lysozyme (HEWL), and stabilize its native structure.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri effectively inhibited HEWL aggregation and fibrillation in a concentration-dependent manner, masked hydrophobic domain exposure, and significantly restored enzymatic activity (nearly 90% recovery after 216 hours). The findings suggest Bacopa Monnieri may be a promising therapeutic for protein misfolding disorders.
population_specificity: In vitro study using hen egg white lysozyme (HEWL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) improves memory by enhancing cell proliferation, neuroblast differentiation, and molecular markers (BDNF and CREB phosphorylation) in the dentate gyrus of mice.
results_summary: BME-treated mice showed improved novel object recognition memory, increased cell proliferation, neuroblast differentiation, and elevated BDNF protein expression and CREB phosphorylation in the dentate gyrus compared to controls.
population_specificity: 7-week-old mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Bacopa monnieri (BM) supplementation could prevent colchicine-induced inflammation and Aβ production, potentially offering a therapeutic intervention for Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: BM supplementation improved cognitive functions, reduced Aβ formation by lowering BACE-1 activity, and attenuated inflammatory and oxidative stress markers in the brain regions of colchicine-administered animals.
population_specificity: Colchicine-administered animals (rodents)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 4-month supplementation of Bacopa monnieri extract combined with multiple micronutrients could improve cognitive functions in Indian school children aged 7-12 years.
results_summary: The fortified beverage did not significantly improve short-term memory or secondary cognitive outcomes compared to the control, except for a transient improvement in spatial working memory strategy at Day 60. The study products were well-tolerated.
population_specificity: Indian school children aged 7-12 years.
effective_dosage: Twice-daily fortified beverage (exact dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) against paraquat-induced neurotoxicity in a Drosophila model of Parkinson's disease.
results_summary: BME treatment reduced mortality and improved climbing ability in Drosophila exposed to paraquat by optimizing redox balance, mitochondrial function, and reducing apoptosis. The mechanisms involved modulation of JNK and caspase-3 activity and stabilization of genes related to oxidative stress and apoptosis.
population_specificity: Drosophila (fruit flies) as a model for Parkinson's disease, with results suggested to be reproducible in higher animal models and humans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa monnieri's protective effects against morphine-induced cerebellar toxicity in rats, focusing on its antioxidant properties.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri methanolic extract (mBME) attenuated morphine-induced histopathological changes in the cerebellum and demonstrated strong free-radical scavenging activity, comparable to ascorbic acid and BHT. The study concluded that mBME exerted a protective effect against morphine-induced cerebellar toxicity due to its antioxidant activity.
population_specificity: Rats (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess and summarize clinical trials investigating Bacopa monnieri-dominant poly-herbal formulas and their effects on cognition, memory, learning, and behavior in children and adolescents.
results_summary: Nine trials met inclusion criteria, with five reporting sufficient data for effect size analysis. Improvements were noted in behavioral outcomes, particularly in visual perception, impulsivity, and attention. However, evidence was weakened by inconsistent statistical design and under-reporting of safety data.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective effects and mechanisms of Bacopa monnieri (BM) in a Parkinsonian mice model induced by MPTP.
results_summary: BM significantly improved motor behavior and biochemical parameters, restored dopamine levels, reduced oxidative stress, and modulated apoptotic proteins, suggesting neuroprotection against MPTP-induced Parkinsonism.
population_specificity: MPTP-induced Parkinsonian mice model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of CDRI-08 (a standardized Bacopa Monnieri extract) on germ cell dynamics, spermatogenesis, sperm quality, and its mechanisms of action in male mice.
results_summary: CDRI-08 improved germ cell dynamics and sperm quality by enhancing antioxidant enzyme activities, activating Nrf2 via p-Akt, and modulating MAPK pathway components (upregulating MAP2K1/MAP2K2 and suppressing MKK4). A total of 26 phytocomponents were identified in the extract.
population_specificity: Male Parkes (P) mice
effective_dosage: 40 and 80 mg/kg body weight, orally administered

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and analyze transcripts involved in the biosynthetic pathway of bacosides in Bacopa monnieri to understand their regulation and tissue-specific distribution.
results_summary: The study identified differentially expressed transcripts related to bacosides production, with CYP450s and UDP-glucosyltransferases upregulated in shoot tissue. It also validated 43 transcripts linked to secondary metabolism and monitored their expression under stress conditions.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on plant tissues)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying Bacopa Monnieri's nootropic effects using transcriptome analysis.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa Monnieri regulates genes involved in mRNA translation, transmembrane transport, oxidative stress response, and protein misfolding, suggesting potential protective effects against brain damage and improved brain development.
population_specificity: SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antinociceptive effects of a standardized methanolic extract of Bacopa monnieri in a chronic constriction injury (CCI) model of neuropathic pain in rats.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri significantly attenuated CCI-induced allodynia and hyperalgesia, improving pain thresholds to pre-surgery baseline levels, though its effects were of lesser magnitude compared to gabapentin.
population_specificity: Rats with chronic constriction injury-induced neuropathic pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether microbial combinations (Chitiniphilus sp. MTN22 and Streptomyces sp. MTN14) could mitigate oxidative stress caused by M. incognita in Bacopa monnieri and enhance its growth and bacoside production.
results_summary: The study found that dual microbial treatment reduced oxidative stress (lower H2O2, lipid peroxidation, and root gall formation) and improved growth and bacoside production in Bacopa monnieri under nematode stress. Microscopic and SEM analysis confirmed microbial colonization and reduced reactive oxygen species (ROS) in treated plants.
population_specificity: Bacopa monnieri plants infected with M. incognita (plant parasitic nematode).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-emetic potential of Bacopa Monnieri methanol and n-butanol fractions against chemotherapy-induced emesis in Suncus murinus.
results_summary: BM-MetFr (10-40 mg/kg) and BM-ButFr (5-20 mg/kg) significantly reduced cisplatin-induced retching/vomiting by 59.4% and 78.9%, respectively, with BM-ButFr showing comparable efficacy to the 5-HT3 antagonist palonosetron. The antioxidant MPG showed a non-significant 44% reduction in emesis.
population_specificity: Suncus murinus (house musk shrew)
effective_dosage: BM-MetFr (10-40 mg/kg, s.c.), BM-ButFr (5-20 mg/kg, s.c.)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Bacopa Monnieri extracts on prostate cancer cell viability and migratory activity, as well as its antimutagenic potential and phenolic compound content.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri extracts showed cytotoxicity to prostate cancer cells (DU 145) and significantly reduced cancer cell motility in non-cytotoxic concentrations. The extracts also exhibited strong antimutagenic activity against nitroquinoline-N-oxide.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer cells (DU 145) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri could act as a cardioprotectant against ischemia/reperfusion injury by assessing its effects on cardiac function, coronary flow, and infarct size.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri significantly increased coronary flow, improved left ventricular developed pressure, and reduced infarct size in rat hearts subjected to ischemia/reperfusion injury. However, higher concentrations reduced ventricular myocyte survival, indicating potential cytotoxicity at elevated doses.
population_specificity: Isolated rat hearts and HL-1 cells (a mouse atrial cardiomyocyte cell line).
study_duration: 30 minutes for perfusion, 30 minutes for ischemia, and 30 minutes for reperfusion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri (BM) could protect human keratinocytes (HaCaT cells) from B[a]P-induced apoptosis by inducing autophagy.
results_summary: BM pretreatment rescued cell viability, reduced ROS-induced apoptosis, preserved mitochondrial membrane potential, and inhibited cytochrome c release in B[a]P-treated HaCaT cells. The cytoprotective effects were mediated through Beclin-1-dependent autophagy activation.
population_specificity: Human keratinocytes (HaCaT cells) in vitro

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy of Bacopa monnieri on memory enhancement in medical students over six weeks of administration.
results_summary: Statistically significant improvements in cognitive function tests were observed with Bacopa monnieri use. Blood biochemistry also showed a significant increase in serum calcium levels, though still within the normal range.
population_specificity: Sixty second-year medical students of either gender from Government Medical College, Nagpur, India.
effective_dosage: 150 mg of standardized Bacopa monnieri extract (Bacognize) twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the neuroprotective effects of Bacopa monnieri extract (BME) and Mucuna pruriens extract (MPE) in a Parkinsonian mouse model induced by MPTP.
results_summary: BME significantly reduced oxidative stress, improved behavioral outcomes (locomotor activity and grip strength), and enhanced tyrosine hydroxylase activity, caspase-3 levels, and neurogenic gene expression in the substantia nigra, suggesting superior neuroprotective effects compared to MPE.
population_specificity: Swiss albino mice (35-45 g) with MPTP-induced Parkinsonism.
effective_dosage: 40 mg/kg body weight of BME, administered orally.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the nephroprotective effects of Bacopa monnieri extracts and stigmasterol in diabetic nephropathy using a rat model.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa monnieri extracts and stigmasterol significantly reduced serum glucose, uric acid, creatinine, and lipid levels, improved antioxidant markers (SOD, GSH), and decreased lipid peroxidation and AGE formation in kidneys.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats with streptozotocin-induced diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Bacopa Monnieri supplementation with cognitive training could enhance cognitive outcomes more effectively than either intervention alone in addressing age-associated cognitive decline.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri was found to improve specific cognitive domains, such as processing speed and memory, likely due to its neuro-molecular mechanisms promoting synaptogenesis. The study hypothesizes that combining Bacopa Monnieri with cognitive training could amplify synaptic changes and cognitive benefits beyond individual interventions.
population_specificity: Older adults experiencing age-associated cognitive decline.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa Monnieri (Brahmi) could enhance cognition and provide neuroprotection by modulating VGLUT3 immunodensity in a phencyclidine (PCP)-induced rat model of schizophrenia.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri improved cognitive deficits in PCP-treated rats by increasing VGLUT3 immunodensity in the prefrontal cortex and striatum when administered after PCP, and prevented cognitive impairment when given before PCP by elevating VGLUT3 in additional brain regions (CA1-3).
population_specificity: Sub-chronic PCP-administered rats (animal model of schizophrenia).
effective_dosage: Not specified for Bacopa Monnieri (PCP dosage: 2 mg/kg, twice daily, intraperitoneal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine Bacopa Monnieri's ability to inhibit pro-inflammatory cytokine release from microglial cells and its effects on enzymes linked to CNS inflammation.
results_summary: Bacopa extracts (tea, infusion, alkaloid, and Bacoside A) significantly inhibited TNF-α and IL-6 release from microglial cells and effectively blocked caspase-1, caspase-3, and matrix metalloproteinase-3 activity. These findings suggest Bacopa can reduce CNS inflammation.
population_specificity: N9 microglial cell line (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri could mitigate hepatotoxicity and nephrotoxicity caused by morphine and street heroin in rats.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri (mBME) effectively reduced elevated serum ALT, AST, and creatinine levels and protected liver and kidneys from opioid-induced toxicity. The extract demonstrated strong antioxidant potential and contained key bioactive components (bacoside-A3, bacopaside-II, and bacopasaponin-C).
population_specificity: Rats exposed to morphine or street heroin.
effective_dosage: 40 mg/kg of mBME, administered two hours before opioids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of CDRI-08, a standardized Bacopa Monnieri extract, on male reproductive health, particularly testicular functions in adult mice.
results_summary: CDRI-08 treatment significantly increased spermatogenic cell density, PCNA index, steroidogenic indices, and sperm viability while reducing abnormal sperm morphology and lipid peroxidation in testis. The results suggest improved sperm quality and testicular function.
population_specificity: Adult Parkes (P) mice
effective_dosage: 40 and 80 mg/kg body weight per day

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of Bacopa monnieri against isoniazid (INH) and rifampicin (RIF)-induced hepatotoxicity in rats and study its interaction with pregnane X receptor (PXR).
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri normalized liver function markers and antioxidant status in rats with INH- and RIF-induced hepatotoxicity. In silico studies showed significant interaction between PXR and bacopaside I, suggesting a potential mechanism for its hepatoprotective effects.
population_specificity: Rats (animal model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chronic administration of CDRI 08 (a Bacopa monnieri extract) improves attention, concentration, and behavior in children with high levels of hyperactivity and/or inattention.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study protocol but does not report results, as it is a trial registration rather than a completed study.
population_specificity: Male children aged 6-14 years with high levels of inattention and hyperactivity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa Monnieri's potential as a therapeutic antioxidant to reduce oxidative stress and improve cognitive function.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa Monnieri, particularly the CDRI08 extract, improves cognitive function in humans and may protect the brain against oxidative damage, though the biological mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract mentions animal, in vitro, and human studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal growth of Bacopa monnieri in vitro and assess its neuroprotective effects against hydrogen peroxide- and staurosporine-induced injury in human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells.
results_summary: Bacopa monnieri extracts at concentrations of 25, 50, and 100 µg/mL inhibited oxidative stress-induced cell damage and improved viability, while lower concentrations (10, 25, and 50 µg/mL) reduced caspase-3 activity and protected mitochondrial membrane potential, indicating anti-apoptotic effects.
population_specificity: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cell line (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate the efficacy of Bacopa Monnieri (Brahmi) as a neuroprotective herb in treating neurodegenerative disorders through evidence-based research.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri was found to enhance cognitive function, reduce oxidative stress, and support neuronal health through mechanisms like antioxidant activity, anti-inflammatory properties, and neurotransmitter modulation. Clinical investigations confirmed its efficacy in neuroprotection.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurodegenerative disorder patients implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Bacopa monnieri extract could modulate NMDAR subunits (NR2A and NR2B) and downstream mediators in the cerebellum of rats with chronic liver failure to prevent neurochemical alterations associated with hepatic encephalopathy.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa monnieri extract reversed the altered NR2A/NR2B ratio and normalized levels of nNOS-apoptotic factors in the cerebellum of rats with chronic liver failure, suggesting neuroprotective effects against hepatic encephalopathy-related neurochemical changes.
population_specificity: Rats with chronic liver failure induced by thioacetamide.
study_duration: 7 days (from day 8 to day 14 of the 14-day thioacetamide administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of medicinal herbs, including Bacopa Monnieri, as a therapy for Parkinson's disease (PD) due to their low teratogenic and adverse effect potential.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Bacopa Monnieri's effects on PD, only mentioning the need for alternative testing models like zebrafish.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract mentions older adults with PD and zebrafish as a potential model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Bacopa Monnieri, among other herbal and nutritional medicines, for improving cognitive function in older adults with and without subjective cognitive impairment (SCI).
results_summary: The review found that Bacopa Monnieri was among the most commonly studied herbal supplements (6/21 studies), with 14/21 studies reporting improvements in at least one cognitive domain. However, the overall evidence was deemed low quality due to high methodological bias.
population_specificity: Older adults with and without subjective cognitive impairment (SCI).
study_duration: Most studies were 12 weeks in length.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the physiological actions and chemopreventive potential of adaptogens, including Bacopa Monnieri, in cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa Monnieri's adaptogens act as effective chemopreventive agents, targeting multiple intracellular proteins in cancer cells, and exert positive effects on various organ systems.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of preclinical and clinical studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether epigenetic regulators (EGRs) from Bacopa monnieri (BMI) could buffer the effects of SCN1A mutation in refractory epilepsy by modulating gene expression and neural pathways.
results_summary: The study suggests that miRNA and bacosides from Bacopa monnieri may help regulate the SCN family and CLCN5 genes, potentially upregulating SCN1A, downregulating seizure-elevated miRNA, and improving cognition via NMDA receptor modulation. However, these effects require further experimental validation.
population_specificity: Patients with refractory epilepsy, specifically Dravet Syndrome (DS), and SCN1A mutation-positive cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Bacopa Monnieri's potential anti-Alzheimer's disease properties, focusing on its multidimensional effects such as antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and memory-enhancing activities.
results_summary: The study highlighted Bacopa Monnieri's multimodal activity, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anti-aggregation, synaptic plasticity modulation, and cognition-enhancing effects, suggesting its potential as a holistic treatment for Alzheimer's disease.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of Bacopa monnieri for cognitive function in Veterans with Gulf War Illness (GWI) and evaluate a remote patient-centric study design for participant recruitment.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Bacopa monnieri's effects, as it focuses on the study design and recruitment strategy rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: U.S. Veterans with Gulf War Illness (GWI)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of Bacopa Monnieri and other medicinal plants in preventing neurodegenerative diseases through various cellular and molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: The abstract suggests Bacopa Monnieri exhibits neuroprotective effects, including alleviation of inflammatory responses, suppression of pro-inflammatory cytokines, and improvement in antioxidative properties, contributing to the prevention of neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of medicinal plants for neurodegenerative diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antifertility potential and safety of Bacopa monnieri in male mice.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa monnieri caused reversible suppression of spermatogenesis and fertility in male mice, with no detectable toxicity reported.
population_specificity: Parkes (P) male mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review literature on the effects of botanicals, including Bacopa Monnieri, on brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on Bacopa Monnieri's effects, only mentioning a general review of botanicals' impact on BDNF.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Bacopa monnieri (CDRI08) on cognitive performance in elderly participants, alongside other supplements, while also examining neurochemical biomarkers and gut microbiota associations.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Bacopa monnieri's effects, as it describes the study design and methods before data analysis commenced.
population_specificity: Elderly participants (older adults)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the available evidence on Bacopa Monnieri and other botanicals for their potential effects on cognitive decline.
results_summary: The study suggests Bacopa Monnieri may have a positive impact on cognitive impairment, either alone or in combination with other nutraceuticals or traditional drugs, though further research is needed to confirm efficacy and safety.
population_specificity: Humans with cognitive impairment or age-related neurodegenerative diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic potential of Bacopa Monnieri in brain disorders, including Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, stroke, epilepsy, and depression, and discuss its mechanisms, clinical trials, and formulation strategies.
results_summary: The study highlights Bacopa Monnieri's potential benefits in brain disorders through modulation of neurotransmission, neurogenesis, oxidative stress, and inflammation, but emphasizes the need for improved formulations and larger clinical trials for clinical translation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review, not a clinical trial)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa Monnieri's neuroprotective potential and its role in developing therapeutic strategies for Parkinson's disease.
results_summary: The abstract suggests Bacopa Monnieri may improve mitochondrial function and alleviate oxidative stress, contributing to neuroprotection, but specific results for Bacopa Monnieri alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on Parkinson's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa Monnieri's potential role in Alzheimer's disease (AD) treatment, focusing on its inclusion in a multi-target combination therapy strategy.
results_summary: The study highlighted Bacopa Monnieri as one of several ethnobotanicals traditionally used in AD, but specific efficacy results for Bacopa Monnieri alone were not detailed. It was considered for a hypothetical "Combination-Drugs-Multi-Targets" (CDMT) strategy based on scoring criteria.
population_specificity: Not specified (general reference to traditional use in Indian, Chinese, and European medicine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore Bacopa Monnieri's potential as an adaptogen and immunomodulator with antioxidant and anticarcinogenic properties.
results_summary: The study suggests Bacopa Monnieri has significant antioxidant and anticarcinogenic properties, mediated through modulation of T-cell immunity, biochemical factors, and tumor-related genes. It highlights its potential in adjuvant or supportive cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human application implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess and summarize clinical trial outcomes and safety of Bacopa monnieri regarding its effects on cognition and behavior in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in language behavior, memory sub-domains, hyperactivity, and attention-deficit domains, with small to medium effect sizes (mean d=0.42). Safety and tolerability were well-reported, with only mild side-effects in 2.3% of participants.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a polyherbal formulation containing Bacopa Monnieri in improving cognitive functions, reducing inflammation, and lowering oxidative stress in healthy elderly individuals and patients with senile dementia of Alzheimer's type (SDAT).
results_summary: The study found that the polyherbal formulation significantly improved cognitive functions, reduced inflammation, and decreased oxidative stress in both healthy elderly subjects and SDAT patients, outperforming donepezil in several key measures.
population_specificity: Healthy elderly subjects (60-75 years) and patients with senile dementia of Alzheimer's type (SDAT).
effective_dosage: 500 mg twice daily (polyherbal formulation containing Bacopa Monnieri).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of standardized Bacopa monnieri extract (SBME) in reducing ADHD symptoms in children.
results_summary: SBME significantly reduced ADHD symptom scores, with improvements in restlessness (93%), self-control (89%), attention-deficit (85%), learning problems (78%), impulsivity (67%), and psychiatric problems (52%). The extract was well-tolerated.
population_specificity: Children aged 6-12 with ADHD onset before age 7, diagnosed via DSM-IV criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of Bacopa monnieri in improving cognitive function through a meta-analysis of randomized, placebo-controlled human trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis of nine studies involving 518 subjects showed that Bacopa monnieri improved cognition, particularly speed of attention, as evidenced by shortened Trail B test times and decreased choice reaction times. The overall quality of the included trials was rated as low risk of bias with high-quality reported information.
population_specificity: Human subjects in randomized, placebo-controlled trials (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of Bacopa monnieri as a future treatment for Alzheimer's disease, particularly in relation to its molecular links with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Bacopa monnieri, alongside nanoparticles, may hold promise for treating Alzheimer's disease, but no specific results or data are provided to confirm its efficacy. The study highlights molecular similarities between Alzheimer's and diabetes but does not detail Bacopa monnieri's direct effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract only mentions general relevance to Alzheimer's and diabetes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the acute cognitive effects of Bacopa monnieri (KeenMind®-CDRI 08) in healthy participants using a double-blind, placebo-controlled design.
results_summary: The 320 mg dose of Bacopa monnieri improved cognitive performance at specific time points post-dosing but had no effect on cardiovascular activity or task-induced stress and fatigue. The study suggested that earlier pharmacological assessment and more sensitive cognitive tests might better reveal acute neurocognitive effects.
population_specificity: 24 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the acute effects of Bacopa monnieri (BM) on cognitive performance, mood, and stress reduction in healthy individuals using a multitasking framework.
results_summary: The study found positive cognitive effects, particularly on Letter Search and Stroop tasks at 1 and 2 hours post-consumption, along with mood improvements and reduced cortisol levels, suggesting stress-reducing and nootropic benefits. However, larger studies are needed to confirm these effects.
population_specificity: Seventeen healthy volunteers
study_duration: Acute (effects measured at 1 and 2 hours post-consumption)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Bacopa Monnieri's neuroprotective properties and therapeutic potential against Alzheimer's disease, focusing on its active components and evidence from in-vitro, pre-clinical, and clinical studies.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri demonstrated therapeutic effects by improving memory, cognition, and learning, reducing Aβ plaque and neurofibrillary tangle formation, and inhibiting inflammatory processes linked to neurodegeneration. The study highlighted its potential in ameliorating Alzheimer's-related neurological changes.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature, including in-vitro, pre-clinical, and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Bacopa Monnieri on immune responses, antioxidant enzyme activities, and intracellular signaling in lymphocytes from rats of different ages.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri reversed age-related declines in IL-2 and IFN-γ production, enhanced antioxidant enzyme activities (CAT, GPx, GST), increased NO production, reduced lipid peroxidation, and modulated intracellular signaling markers (p-ERK1/2, p-CREB, p-Akt) in early middle-aged and old rats.
population_specificity: Young (3-month-old), early middle-aged (8- to 9-month-old), and old (18-month-old) F344 rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine whether Bacopa monnieri enhances cognitive performance in humans, focusing on memory and other cognitive domains.
results_summary: Bacopa improved performance in 9 of 17 memory free recall tests but showed little evidence of enhancement in other cognitive domains. The effects on reasoning, number facility, and language behavior were understudied.
population_specificity: Adult humans without dementia or significant cognitive impairment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Bacopa Monnieri's potential as a safe and effective treatment for chronic pain, including its antidepressant, antinociceptive, and anti-inflammatory effects, as well as its ability to mitigate opioid-related side effects.
results_summary: Bacopa Monnieri demonstrated strong antidepressant and antinociceptive effects comparable to morphine, inhibited opioid-withdrawal hyperalgesia and morphine tolerance, and exhibited anti-inflammatory properties via COX-2 inhibition. It was also reported to protect against opioid-induced organ toxicity and was well-tolerated in clinical trials.
population_specificity: Multiple age groups in preclinical and clinical studies (specific demographics not detailed).
interactions: Inhibits opioid-withdrawal hyperalgesia and morphine tolerance; no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore Bacopa Monnieri's potential as a therapy for Alzheimer's disease, focusing on its ethnobotanical uses and mechanistic effects relevant to AD pathology.
results_summary: The abstract suggests Bacopa Monnieri shows promising mechanistic effects for Alzheimer's disease, though specific clinical outcomes are not detailed. It is grouped with other plants under investigation for cognitive and behavioral symptoms of dementia.
population_specificity: Not specified (general dementia patients implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective properties, nootropic activity, and therapeutic potential of Bacopa Monnieri for memory loss and cognitive deficits.
results_summary: The study found that Bacopa Monnieri has neuroprotective properties and nootropic activity, with therapeutic implications for memory loss. It also highlighted ongoing patent activity focused on extraction methods, compound purification, and synergistic formulations.
population_specificity: Patients with memory loss and cognitive deficits (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare balneotherapy in the health systems of Spain, France, Italy, and Portugal, focusing on coverage, financing, workforce, techniques, regulation, and service provision.
results_summary: The study found similarities in inputs and techniques across countries, with variations in treatment cycle duration. Doctors with hydrology expertise dominate the workforce, and services are regulated by national health ministries, primarily in accredited establishments.
population_specificity: Health systems of Spain, France, Italy, and Portugal (no specific patient population detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a non-pharmacological intervention combining balneotherapy with sleep-promoting measures on sleep quality, physical examination indicators, and general physical symptoms in individuals with sleep disorders.
results_summary: The intervention significantly improved sleep quality (reduced Insomnia Severity Index scores), decreased body mass index, waist circumference, fasting blood glucose, and triglycerides, and improved general health problems (70% or more improvement rate). Systolic blood pressure increased significantly, but other indicators like total cholesterol and diastolic blood pressure remained unchanged.
population_specificity: 31 volunteers with sleep disorders.
effective_dosage: Balneotherapy 1-2 times per day, health lectures (~1 hour daily), daily exercise (yoga, hiking, etc.), and controlled diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of balneotherapy for treating chronic venous insufficiency (CVI) by comparing it to no treatment or other interventions.
results_summary: Balneotherapy slightly improved disease severity, pain, and skin pigmentation changes compared to no treatment, with uncertain effects on quality of life, edema, and leg ulcers. Adverse effects were minimal, and comparisons with other treatments were limited.
population_specificity: 1126 participants with chronic venous insufficiency (CVI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of balneotherapy for chronic low back pain in individuals over 60 years old and identify responder profiles using trajectory model analysis.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant reduction in pain intensity at 3 months, with 36% of participants showing a meaningful effect size (>0.5). However, 41% experienced no improvement or increased pain. Two distinct pain trajectories were identified, with one group showing larger reductions in pain and better physical activity levels.
population_specificity: Individuals >60 years old with chronic low back pain (mean age 68.3 ± 5.3 years, 69.2% women).
study_duration: Assessments were conducted at days 1, 21, and months 3 and 6.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of balneotherapy on non-inflammatory complaints, quality of life, and work productivity in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in remission or low disease activity.
results_summary: Balneotherapy improved several subdomains of physical condition and general health, with durable effects observed. Physical health and pain showed a tendency for short-term improvement, and daily activity improved by the end of the observation period, though fatigue worsened despite treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in remission or low disease activity from three rheumatology centers.
effective_dosage: 15 sessions over a 3-week period, each lasting 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare blood pressure and pulse adaptation characteristics between younger and older patients with musculoskeletal disorders during acute and recovery responses at the first and 10th sessions of balneotherapy added to physiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in pulse values between younger and older adults, with greater pulse alterations observed in young adults during acute and recovery phases of balneotherapy sessions. No significant differences were found between sessions or in blood pressure responses.
